betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Having a source of infinite water is all well and good, but that doesn't get you anything you didn't have around the Steam Age. Sure, the throughput difference is night and supernova, but you'd like something §onew§r.

Everburn Urns consume Ignis centi-Vis to produce lava - specifically 1 centi-Vis is consumed per Urn to produce 250mb of lava every 10 ticks. Given that centi-Vis pours infinitely from energized nodes this means you've potentially got infinite energy on your hands here... but these urns do nothing a nuclear reactor couldn't, in that respect.

What these urns will do is give you a convenient, consistent source of lava right in your own home... which sounds mildly dangerous, but you've dealt with worse. Any odd recipe that tries to trip you up with lava, or Obsidian, you need never worry about.

§3For the record four Everburn Urns will cap out one LHE, producing half as much superheated steam that the same LHE running Hot Coolant from a fluid nuke would produce. And fluid nukes are §oexceptionally§r§3 fuel efficient, so supply will not be a concern.
